page.title: 10FISHING
page.content: The main shellfish that the inshore fishermen catch near Durness are lobsters,edible crab,scallops and prawns.There are various kinds of fish caught such as sullocks,mackerel, herring and halibut.Some of the fishermen still use single creels in their large dingies.There are three big creel boats,the Pamalkay,the Gem and the Bountiful.The catch is usually landed locally at Rispond pier or at Kinlochbervie further down the West coast. There are many lochs in which anglers fish. Loch Caladail, Meadaidh, Borralie and many more. In the lochs and rivers are trout and salmon. A few anglers fish in the Kyle of Durness. They use either tobies, spinners or flies. The anglers often stay in the Cape Wrath Hotel which is close by the Kyle.
